Pieces OS doesn't start due to database corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #686

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Update Issues
common_issues.description: Users reported issues after updating to Pieces OS 11.3.0, including authentication failures getting stuck at the authentication URL, database corruption preventing startup, and application crashes on macOS. Solutions involved bug fixes in subsequent updates (11.3.1, 11.3.2), requiring users to update to the latest version.

related_issues.title: Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
related_issues.text:
Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After updating pieces to latest version, I was loggged out (This was part of the update, which I saw in the update / release notes.). But when I try to log in, always end up at https://authentication.pieces.services/ without moving forward. that page keep loading and nothing happens.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation about Authentication Issues

**Key points:**

* Users are experiencing issues logging in to Pieces after updating to version 11.3.0.
* The authentication process gets stuck on https://authentication.pieces.services/
* The issue affects both Pieces Desktop and PiecesOS.
* Users have tried logging in using both Gmail and GitHub accounts.
* Some users have also reported issues with cloud backups and domain connections.

**Problems identified:**

* The authentication flow is broken after the update.
* Users are unable to connect their Google or GitHub accounts.
* Support logs are needed for further troubleshooting.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* The Pieces team is investigating the issue and will release a fix soon.
* Users are requested to send support logs for further analysis.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue has been identified and fixed.
* Authentication is working again for most users.
* Users are advised to try logging in again.

**Additional notes:**

* The issue appears to be specific to Windows 11 users.
* The Pieces team is actively working on resolving the issue for all affected users.

**I hope this summary is helpful. Please let me know if you have any other questions.**

The latest version doesn't start. 

Here is the log in com.pieces.os/production/Support/logs:

[38;5;12m[I][0m  initializeDataSingletons

[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: 
[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: 
[D]  Windows: Notification Timeout: Went into side panel
## Summary of GitHub Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* New user (antoine79) experiencing issues with the initial bootup of Pieces OS.
* User's database is corrupted.
* User's computer lacks AVX2 support, which is required for CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch extension.

**Problems Identified:**

* Database corruption preventing Pieces OS from launching.
* Dependency on AVX2 excluding older CPUs like user's Intel i7-2600.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Debugging logs implemented in version 11.3.1 for further investigation.
* Manual creation of `com.pieces.os\production\Pieces\couchbase.cblite2` folder suggested by user.
* Fix for the database corruption issue implemented in version 11.3.2.
* Possible removal of AVX2 dependency in future versions (not explicitly mentioned).

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue resolved with the release of version 11.3.2.
* User acknowledged and thanked for their patience and contribution.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user was helpful in identifying the root cause by providing detailed logs and information about their hardware.
* Pieces Support team actively engaged with the user to understand and resolve the issues.

**Overall, this conversation exemplifies effective troubleshooting and communication between a user and support team, leading to a successful resolution.**

related_issues.title: Application Crash on Startup
related_issues.text:
Application Crash on Startup
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Upon launching the application, it crashes immediately with an error message stating "Unexpected error occurred." This issue started occurring after updating to version 11.0.0. The crash seems to be related to the new plugin integration. Steps to reproduce:


## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* Moazzem-pixel reported an app crash issue on macOS 12.3 with MacBook Air (2022), M2.
* Crash logs and error messages were provided for analysis.
* The issue was suspected to be similar to https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/686.

**Problems identified:**

* The app was crashing unexpectedly.
* This prevented Moazzem-pixel from using the app as expected.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces suggested checking if the issue was the same as https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/686.
* If not, a support call was recommended.
* Mark-at-pieces later informed that the issue should be resolved with the latest version 11.3.2.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue was resolved with the latest version 11.3.2.
* Moazzem-pixel was asked to reopen the ticket if the issue persisted after updating. 
* No further updates were provided, suggesting the issue was successfully resolved.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Database Corruption on Startup
common_issues.description: Users reported Pieces OS failing to start due to database corruption on macOS and Windows. The issue was linked to plugin integration and database initialization failures.  Solutions included updating to the latest version (11.3.2), which contained a fix for the corruption issue, and ensuring compatibility with AVX2 instruction sets for Couchbase database functionality.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS doesn't start due to database corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #686
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS doesn't start due to database corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #686
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Early Access Program

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces OS fails to start because it is unable to open the database due to corruption. The error message displayed is: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.

Steps to Reproduce:

Attempt to start Pieces OS on macOS.
Observe the error message indicating database corruption.
Expected Behavior: I expected Pieces OS to start normally and access the database without any issues.
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points:**

* User @moazzem-pixel reported an issue with Pieces OS not starting due to database corruption.
* The bot suggested related issues and resources for troubleshooting.
* @mark-at-pieces identified the issue as a duplicate of another report.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces OS fails to start due to database corruption.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* User directed to a similar existing issue for further discussion and resolution.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue closed as a duplicate and discussion continued in the referenced issue.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user was provided with resources for troubleshooting the issue.
* No further information is available on the resolution of the problem.

## Summary of GitHub Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* New user (antoine79) experiencing issues with the initial bootup of Pieces OS.
* User's database is corrupted.
* User's computer lacks AVX2 support, which is required for CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch extension.

**Problems Identified:**

* Database corruption preventing Pieces OS from launching.
* Dependency on AVX2 excluding older CPUs like user's Intel i7-2600.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Debugging logs implemented in version 11.3.1 for further investigation.
* Manual creation of `com.pieces.os\production\Pieces\couchbase.cblite2` folder suggested by user.
* Fix for the database corruption issue implemented in version 11.3.2.
* Possible removal of AVX2 dependency in future versions (not explicitly mentioned).

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue resolved with the release of version 11.3.2.
* User acknowledged and thanked for their patience and contribution.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user was helpful in identifying the root cause by providing detailed logs and information about their hardware.
* Pieces Support team actively engaged with the user to understand and resolve the issues.

**Overall, this conversation exemplifies effective troubleshooting and communication between a user and support team, leading to a successful resolution.**

recommendations: "Investigate and address the root cause of authentication issues after updates to prevent recurrence."
"Prioritize thorough testing of database functionality during the development and release process to avoid corruption issues."
"Explore options for removing or mitigating the dependency on AVX2 instruction sets to ensure compatibility with a wider range of hardware."
"Improve communication to users about potential breaking changes and required hardware specifications in update release notes."
